private_information: I arrive at Union Square at 09:00
I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I can travel between Union Square and Chinatown; travel time is 7 minutes each way
I can remain mobile throughout the day and can accept meetings at various times
traveler.goal: Meet as many friends as possible while meeting Joshua for at least 75 minutes.

private_information: I will be at Chinatown from 18:00 to 21:30
I prefer meetings of at least 30 minutes but I can commit to a 75 minute meeting
My primary location while available is Chinatown
joshua.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 75 minutes between 18:00 and 21:30 in Chinatown.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent reports and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver to maximize the number of friends met while satisfying timing and travel constraints, especially the Joshua constraint of at least 75 minutes.

public_information: Travel distances in minutes: Union Square to Chinatown 7, Chinatown to Union Square 7
You arrive at Union Square at 09:00
Joshua will be at Chinatown from 18:00 to 21:30
You must meet Joshua for a minimum of 75 minutes during his availability window
Objective is to consider various schedules and pick the best one to maximize friends met while satisfying constraints

report.system_prompt: You are the traveler planning a day in San Francisco. Provide your constraints, preferences, and candidate meeting time windows with friends. Do not emit PDDL. Use public information and your private information to enumerate feasible meeting windows and explain tradeoffs.
report.prompt: Your name is traveler. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private information: {agents->traveler->private_information} Your goal: {agents->traveler->goal} Think step by step and produce several schedule options that respect travel times and your arrival time. For each option provide a sequence of meeting windows, locations, start and end times, travel legs between locations, and any assumptions about flexibility.

report.system_prompt: You are Joshua. Provide your precise availability windows, location while available, and flexibility about start or end times. Do not emit PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is joshua. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private information: {agents->joshua->private_information} Your goal: {agents->joshua->goal} State exact available start and end times, confirm you are located in Chinatown during availability, and indicate any flexibility for meeting scheduling or preferred durations.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning targeting the FastDownwards planner. Using the agents' reports and public information, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the scheduling optimization. The model must include locations, travel durations in minutes, time windows, meeting actions per friend, and an objective to maximize number of meetings while enforcing that the meeting with Joshua is at least 75 minutes within his availability. Keep actions of different agents distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure compatibility with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You receive the travelers' reports and public information. Build a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Model locations Union Square and Chinatown, travel actions with durations, meeting actions with durations and time windows, and constraints ensuring Joshua is met for at least 75 minutes between 18:00 and 21:30 in Chinatown. Include objective to maximize the number of meetings. Keep agent actions distinct and resolve any naming ambiguities from inputs. Output the PDDL domain enclosed by <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem enclosed by <problem></problem>.
